description: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 4, 7} mod 8.
comments: Related to a Chebyshev transform of A046055. See A074231. - _Paul Barry_, Oct 27 2004Starting (1, 4, 7, ...) = partial sums of (1, 3, 3, 1, 1, 3, 3, 1, 1, 3, 3, 1, 1, ...). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 19 2008The product of any two terms belongs to the sequence and therefore also a(n)^2, a(n)^3, a(n)^4 etc. [_Bruno Berselli_, Nov 28 2012]Nonnegative m such that floor(k*(m/4)^2) = k*floor((m/4)^2), where k can assume the values from 4 to 15. See also the second comment in A047513. [_Bruno Berselli_, Dec 03 2015]
